Kolam jimat RM47,000
07 Nov 2019, 08:01 by Oleh Faliq Lajim



HEZLINE yang menyambut ulang tahun kelahiran pada pertengahan bulan lalu.






KOLAM yang dibina Hezline.


“SAYA memang sudah pasang niat untuk bina kolam di sebelah rumah sejak dua tahun lalu.
“Cuma tidak mampu berikutan ia memerlukan kos RM50,000, jadi saya buat kolam sendiri,” kata jurumekap artis, Hezline Atherra Mohd Zulkifli, 26, ketika dihubungi, semalam.
Hezline Atherra berkata, dia membina kolam berkenaan sempena ulang tahun kelahirannya pada pertengahan bulan lalu untuk dihadiahkan kepada dua anaknya.
Menurutnya, dia membina kolam itu sebagai tanda kasih sayang terhadap anaknya, Mohammad Darryl Abrar Mohd Uzair Hakimi, 3, dan Mohammad Daiyyan Abrar, 1.
“Pada mulanya apabila saya menyatakan hasrat untuk bina kolam berkenaan, ramai orang kata ia adalah suatu perkara yang mustahil termasuk suami dan adik-adik saya.
“Namun, mereka turut membantu saya apabila melihat kesungguhan saya untuk korek tanah sehingga lima kaki dalam di sebelah rumah,” katanya yang menetap di Kemaman, Terengganu.



Hezline Atherra yang mempunyai kelulusan Diploma Kejuruteraan dari Politeknik Sultan Mizan Zainal Abidin, Dungun berkata, dia mengambil masa lebih sebulan menyiapkan seluruh kolam itu.
“Daripada lakaran, korek, ikat batu dan saliran paip semua buat sendiri dan dibantu adik-adik dan juga suami dengan kos membabitkan kira-kira RM3,000.
“Memang penat sebab semua kerja membina kolam itu saya akan buat selepas pulang daripada bekerja,” katanya.
“Namun, usaha itu berbaloi apabila melihat keseronokan dan gelak tawa anak-anak yang dapat mandi dalam kolam berkenaan,” katanya.
Menurutnya, walaupun kolam itu agak kecil, ia cukup untuk memuatkan dia sekeluarga.
“Kami juga membina sebuah gazebo sendiri dengan kos RM2,000 supaya senang untuk membuat majlis perjumpaan keluarga nanti,” katanya.

The pool saves RM47,000
07 Nov 2019, 08:01 by Faliq Lajim



HEZLINE, which celebrates its birth anniversary in the middle of last month.






Hezline-built COLOR.


"I've been planning to build a pool next to my house for the past two years.
"I couldn't afford it because it cost me about RM50,000, so I made my own pool," said artist spokesperson Hezline Atherra Mohd Zulkifli, 26, when contacted yesterday.
Hezline Atherra said she built the pool for her birthday in the middle of last month to give to her two children.
He said he built the pool as a token of affection for his children, Mohammad Darryl Abrar Mohd Uzair Hakimi, 3, and Mohammad Daiyyan Abrar, 1.
“Initially when I expressed my desire to build the pool, many people said it was impossible including my husband and my siblings.
"However, they also helped me when I saw my determination to dig up to five feet inland next to the house," said a resident of Kemaman, Terengganu.



Hezline Atherra, who holds a Diploma in Engineering from Sultan Mizan Polytechnic Zainal Abidin, said Dungun said it took him more than a month to complete the entire pool.
“From sketches, lifts, boulders and drainage work all to one another and assisted by the siblings and the husband at a cost of about RM3,000.
"It's exhausting because of all the work I have done to build the pool after I get home from work," he said.
"However, it is worth the effort to see the fun and laughter of the children who can bathe in the pool," he said.
He said although the pool was small, it was enough to accommodate him and his family.
"We also built our own gazebo at RM2,000 so it would be nice to have a family reunion later," he said.
